title: Instance Configuration
description:
Configuration for a single world. Settings in here only affect the world this configuration belongs to.

Instances share this configuration but ignore certain parameters (e.g. UUID). In this case the configuration willbe cloned before loading the instance.

DisplayName.description: The player facing name of this world.

Seed.description:
The seed of the world, used for world generation.

If a seed is not set then one will be randomly generated.

SpawnProvider.description:
Sets the spawn provider for the world. 

This controls where new players will enter the world at. This can be provided by world generation in some cases.

WorldGen.description: Sets the world generator that will be used by the world.

ChunkStorage.description: Sets the storage system that will be used by the world to store chunks.

IsTicking.description: Sets whether chunks in this world are ticking or not.

IsBlockTicking.description: Sets whether blocks in this world are ticking or not.

IsPvpEnabled.description: Sets whether PvP is allowed in this world or not.

IsFallDamageEnabled.description: Sets whether fall damage is allowed in this world or not.

IsGameTimePaused.description:
Sets whether the game time is paused.

This effects things like day/night cycles and things that rely on those.

GameTime.description: The current time of day in the world.

ForcedWeather.description: Sets the type of weather that is being forced to be active in this world.

ClientEffects.description: Settings for the client's weather and post-processing effects in this world.

RequiredPlugins.description: Sets the plugins that are required to be enabled for this world to function.

GameMode.title: GameMode
GameMode.description: Sets the default gamemode for this world.
enumDescriptions: The normal gamemode for players playing the game.
Makes the player invulnerable and grants them the ability to fly.
markdownEnumDescriptions: The normal gamemode for players playing the game.
Makes the player invulnerable and grants them the ability to fly.

IsSpawningNPC.description: Whether NPCs can spawn in this world or not.

IsSpawnMarkersEnabled.description: Whether spawn markers are enabled for this world.

IsAllNPCFrozen.description: Whether all NPCs are frozen for this world

GameplayConfig.description: The gameplay configuration being used by this world

Death.description: Inline death configuration overrides for this world. If set, these values take precedence over the referenced GameplayConfig.

DaytimeDurationSeconds.description: Override for the duration of daytime in seconds. If set, takes precedence over the referenced GameplayConfig.

NighttimeDurationSeconds.description: Override for the duration of nighttime in seconds. If set, takes precedence over the referenced GameplayConfig.

IsCompassUpdating.description: Whether the compass is updating in this world

IsSavingPlayers.description: Whether the configuration for player's is being saved for players in this world.

IsSavingChunks.description: Whether the chunk data is allowed to be saved to the disk for this world.

SaveNewChunks.description:
Whether newly generated chunks should be marked for saving or not.
Enabling this can prevent random chunks from being out of place if/when worldgen changes but will increase the size of the world on disk.

IsUnloadingChunks.description: Whether the chunks should be unloaded like normally, or should be prevented from unloading at all.

IsObjectiveMarkersEnabled.description: Whether objective markers are enabled for this world.

DeleteOnUniverseStart.description: Whether this world should be deleted when loaded from Universe start. By default this is when going through the world folders in the universe directory.

DeleteOnRemove.description: Whether this world should be deleted once its been removed from the server

ResourceStorage.description: Sets the storage system that will be used to store resources.

StartupInstance.description: The name of the instance to spawn players into when they first join this world.

RemovalConditions.description:
The set of conditions that have to be met to remove the world.

If no conditions are provided (e.g. a empty list) then the world will not be removed automatically

ReturnPoint.description: The location to send players to when leaving this world.

PreventReconnection.description:
Whether to prevent reconnecting into this world.

Players that reconnect back into the world will forced out of the world to the return point (or their own).

Discovery.description: Optional discovery configuration for displaying an event title when a player enters this instance for the first time.
